Detailed Description

Reads a data file which is in binary compressed format.

Member Function Documentation

bool ntee::BinaryDataReader::eof (  )  const

Check for end of file marker.

True if the end of file marker has been read by the stream.

Returns:
true if the stream has reached the eof. false if not.

Definition at line 91 of file BinaryDataReader.cpp.

Buffer * ntee::BinaryDataReader::getNext ( const TransferType &  tt  ) 

Returns the next buffer of the proper transfer type. If no more buffers exist, the routine will return null.

Returns:
a dynamically allocated buffer which contains all the data from the next frame with transfer type tt. OR null if there are no more buffers of type tt.

Definition at line 62 of file BinaryDataReader.cpp.

Buffer * ntee::BinaryDataReader::getNext (  ) 

Returns next Buffer in datafile.

This routine is different from its cousin which takes an TransferType argument in that this routine returns the next buffer in the file regardless of its transmission type.

Returns:
a dynamically allocated Buffer, or NULL if the eof has been reached.

Definition at line 79 of file BinaryDataReader.cpp.

bool ntee::BinaryDataReader::good (  )  const
Returns:
true if the file stream is okay

Definition at line 50 of file BinaryDataReader.cpp.

int ntee::BinaryDataReader::open ( const std::string &  s  ) 

Opens the data file for reading.

Opens a file for reading. If the file does not exist, or can't be opened this routine will return -1.

Parameters:
s path to a file name.
Returns:
0 when everything is okay, -1 if there were problems with opening the file.
